CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Enforcement proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .
CARDINAL . He was employed by ORG , a company based in PERSON ( hereinafter “ the debtor ” ) .

CARDINAL . Since the debtor had failed to fulfil its obligations toward its employees , the applicant brought a civil claim , seeking payment of salary arrears and various social security contributions .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) in PERSON rendered a decision ordering the debtor to pay him certain sum . On DATE this decision became final .

CARDINAL . Due to the debtor ’s failure to fulfil its obligations from this decision , the applicant submitted an enforcement request . On DATE the ORG ( PERSON ) in Požega issued an enforcement order to that effect .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( NORP sud ) in PERSON opened insolvency proceedings in respect of the debtor . As a result , all of the ongoing enforcement proceedings against the debtor were terminated .
CARDINAL . The applicant duly reported his claim based on the above - mentioned court decision to the insolvency administration .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court accepted the applicant ’s claim .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the applicant ’s representative informed the ORG that the decision at issue had been partially enforced in the insolvency proceedings .
CARDINAL . The insolvency proceedings in respect of the debtor are still ongoing .
CARDINAL . The debtor , which operated as a socially - owned company , was privatised on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the privatisation was annulled because the buyer in question had failed to fulfil his contractual obligations .
CARDINAL . Following the annulment of the debtor ’s privatisation the ORG owned PERCENT of shares in the company .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG sold its shares to a private company .
